bapsflib.lapdhdf¶

The lapdhdf module contains the necessary tools to open, identify, check, map out, and read out data written into HDF5 files by the LaPD DAQ system.

Subpackages¶

  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_msi

Modules¶

  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.files
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfchecks
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata

bapsflib.lapdhdf.files¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File(name, mode='r', driver=None, libver=None, userblock_size=None, swmr=False, **kwds)¶

Bases: h5py._hl.files.File

Open a HDF5 File.

see h5py documentation for h5py.File details: http://docs.h5py.org/en/latest/

Parameters:
  • name – Name of file (str or unicode)
  • mode – Mode in which to open the file. (default ‘r’ read-only)
  • driver – File driver to use
  • libver – Compatibility bounds
  • userblock_size – Size (in bytes) of the user block. If nonzero, must be a power of 2 and at least 512.
  • swmr – Single Write, Multiple Read
  • kwds – Driver specific keywords

Warning

Do not use. Will be deprecated.

Parameters:name – name of Group/Dataset
Returns:str indicating if name is a ‘Group’ of ‘Dataset’
listHDF_file_types¶
Returns:a list of strings indicating if an HDF5 item is a Group or Dataset. This has a one-to-one correspondence to listHDF_files.
listHDF_files¶
Returns:a list of strings representing the absolute paths (including Group/Dataset name) for each Group and Dataset in the HDF5 file.
read_data(board, channel, shots=None, digitizer=None, adc=None, config_name=None)¶
Parameters:
  • board (int) – desired board number
  • channel (int) – desired channel number
  • shots (list(int)) –
  • digitizer (str) – name of desired digitizer
  • adc (str) – name of desired analog-digital converter
  • config_name (str) – name of data configurations
Returns:

instance of lapdhdf.hdfReadData
tupHDF_fileSys¶
Returns:zip(listHDF_files, listHDF_file_types)

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors¶

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error¶

Bases: Exception

Base class for exceptions in the lapdhdf module.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NoMSIError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if no MSI group is detected in the opened HDF5 file.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotHDFFileError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if desired object is not an instance of h5py.File.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotKnownLaPDHDFError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if the HDF5 file was generated by the DAQ system but is not a known software version.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotLaPDHDFError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if HDF5 file was not generated by the LaPD DAQ system.

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers.hdfMap(hdf_obj)¶

Bases: object

Constructs a complete file mapping of hdf_obj that is utilized by lapdhdf.File to manipulate and read data out of the HDF5 file.

Parameters:hdf_obj – an object instance of lapdhdf.File
data_group = 'Raw data + config'¶
digitizers¶
Returns:A dictionary style container for all digitizer mappings.

For example, to retrieve mappings of digitizer group ‘SIS 3301’ one would call

fmap = hdfMap(file_obj)
dmap = fmap.digitizers['SIS 3301']
has_data_group¶
Returns:True/False if ‘Raw data + config/’ group is detected
has_data_run_sequence¶
Returns:True/False if the ‘Data run sequence/’ group is found in the data group
has_digitizers¶
Returns:True/False if any known digitizers are discovered in the data group
has_motion_lists¶
Returns:True/False if any known motion groups are discovered in the data group
has_msi_group¶
Returns:True/False if ‘MSI/’ group is detected
has_unknown_data_subgoups¶
Returns:True/False if any unknown groups are discovered in the data groups. These groups could end up being digitizer groups and/or motion groups.
hdf_version¶
Returns:str identifying the LaPD DAQ Software version number used to generated the HDF5 file (‘’ if NOT LaPD generated)
is_lapd_hdf¶
Returns:True/False if HDF5 file was generated by the LaPD
main_digitizer¶
Returns:an instance of the main digitizer in self.digitizers

The main digitizer is determine by scanning through the local tuple possible_candidates that contains a hierarchical list of digitizers. The first digitizer found is considered the main digitizer.

possible_candidates = ('SIS 3301', 'SIS crate')
motionlists¶
Returns:A dictionary style container for all motionlist mappings.

For example, to retrieve mappings of the motionlist group ‘6k Compumotor’ one would call

fmap = hdfMap(file_obj)
mmap = fmap.motionlists['6k Compumotor']
msi¶
Returns:A dictionary style container for all MSI diagnostic mappings.

For example, to retrieve mappings of LaPD’s Magnetic field one would call

fmap = hdfMap(file_obj)
bmap = fmap.msi['Magnetic field']
msi_group = 'MSI'¶
unknowns¶
Returns:A dictionary container for all subgroups in data_group that are unknown to the mapping constructor.

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata.hdfReadData(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: numpy.ndarray

Reads the data out of the HDF5 file:

info¶

A dictionary container of metadata for the extracted data. The dict() keys are:

hdf file str HDF5 file name the data was retrieved from
dataset name str name of the dataset
dataset path str path to said dataset in the HDF5 file
digitizer str digitizer group name
adc str analog-digital converter in which the data was recorded on
bit int bit resolution for the adc
sample rate (int, float) tuple containing sample rate, e.g. (100.0, ‘MHz’)
board int board that the probe was connected to
channel int channel of the board that the probe was connected to
voltage offset float voltage offset of the digitized signal
probe name str name of deployed probe…empty for user to use at his/her discretion
port (int, str) 2-element tuple indicating which port the probe was deployed on, eg. (19, ‘W’)

When inheriting from numpy, the object creation and initialization is handled by __new__ instead of __init__.

Parameters:
  • hdf_file –
  • board (int) –
  • channel (int) –
  • shots (None, int, list(int), or slice(start, stop, skip)) – index/indices of shots to be extracted
  • digitizer (str) –
  • adc (str) –
  • config_name (str) –
  • keep_bits (bool) – set True keep data in bits opposed to converting to voltage
__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶
static __new__(hdf_file, board, channel, shots=None, digitizer=None, adc=None, config_name=None, keep_bits=False)¶

When inheriting from numpy, the object creation and initialization is handled by __new__ instead of __init__.

Parameters:
  • hdf_file –
  • board (int) –
  • channel (int) –
  • shots (None, int, list(int), or slice(start, stop, skip)) – index/indices of shots to be extracted
  • digitizer (str) –
  • adc (str) –
  • config_name (str) –
  • keep_bits (bool) – set True keep data in bits opposed to converting to voltage

Returns:Convert DAQ signal dependent axis from index to time.

convert_to_v()¶
Returns:Convert DAQ signal from bits to voltage.

Warning

dt¶
Returns:time-step dt (in sec) from the ‘sample rate’ dict() item of self.info.
dv¶
Returns:voltage-step dv (in Volts) from the ‘bit’ and ‘voltage offset’ dict() items of self.info.
full_path()¶
Returns:full path of the dataset in the HDF5 file.

Warning

Not implemented yet
